page.title: 04The Village of Buntingford
page.content: Buntingford is reckoned to be a village, though now rather a large one.It began to grow in the late 1960's, when Sainsburys built a distribution depot here, with a large housing-estate. Large private developments have also occured. Sainsburys are by far the largest local employers. From Buntingford, people commute to work in many parts of London and the Home Counties. There is very little Public Transport. Traffic is a problem, as two very busy roads(A.10 and A.505) serve the village. A By-pass is to be started shortly. Its planned route has annoyed some residents and conservationists.
